1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFA.body:
> [steelmemes](#comment_26_1N2JLPM7vMtsQkPZiatLHyU6shFKP7aZWg): What version of Zeronet are you guys running? I had nothing but problems when I updated to 0.7 (first version to use python 3) from the Zeronet site for a few hours. I downgraded back to 0.6.5 (uses python 2) and everything's been working smoothly since. I even had a clean transition to a ZeroID. Downgrading might be worth trying if you've exhausted all other options.

I'm on 0.6.5 and experiencing the same issue

try clicking on "Check files" on the right hand side of 08chan's listing in the Sites section of your ZeroHello sidebar.  Seems to have forced an update for me - 'updating' number refreshed, reduced greatly and went down to 0 over a couple of mins.

> [undisclosed](#comment_8_13QmjccZb92J1V7RpF8dkz4VQtJShJwuHK): Test posting is only showing "Processing post... Please wait."  It does appear functioning for some anons though.  Catalog seems way to minimal with seven threads and a total of 36 replies.  That would be over the past 20+ hours now.  Suppose there are only a fraction of legitimate peers, out of a large number induced during the spam attack?  If I can only connect with five at a time, how can I tell with each attempt if these are changing?

Sorry - not much to add beyond what I posted...I don't have much in the catalog either, but really don't understand enough about zeronet to give an informed reply.

1565197761_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehE.body:
I think there's 2 things that will hold ZeroNet back from wide adoption (apart from the propoganda):

1. Bit of learning cliff for most to get it running
2. The storage space to keep it running if/once it really takes off

I've only been kicking the tires here for a couple of days, but in my limited understanding, to make ZeroNet robust most users need to maintain full copies of the sites...probably not really a big problem with text based sites, but for image boards or video sites it will quickly get pretty large...

> [bustooni](#comment_5_13v3xsu1y5pTbf3ZydiKYCZUhCFqdAs2NY): I think there's 2 things that will hold ZeroNet back from wide adoption (apart from the propoganda): [...]

Should have added - love the idea and principle though.  Need to find ways to get this out to a wider audience and lessen the leap to get up and running for most.
